channel.title: Community Access
channel.description: News and press releases from Community Access -- making software accessible by default with AI-powered accessibility agents.

item.title: Accessibility Agents v2.1: Developer Tools Team, 5 Platforms, and 55 Agents
item.description: v2.1 brings a complete Developer Tools team with 6 new agents for Python, wxPython, desktop accessibility, and tool building. Plus CI/CD scanner integration, 3 structured audit rule sets, and platform support expanded to Codex CLI and Gemini CLI.

item.title: Building an Accessible Calendar with AI -- and Letting the Agents Review Their Own Work
item.description: A walkthrough of building the Community Access calendar with Claude Code, running our own accessibility agents against it, and why the grid pattern got thrown out for an agenda list.

item.title: Blind Developers Launch Open Source AI Agent Teams to Fix Accessibility Gap in AI Coding Tools
item.description: Community Access announces the public launch of Accessibility Agents -- 47 specialized AI agents, 14 knowledge modules, and 52 pre-built prompts across Claude Code, GitHub Copilot, and Claude Desktop.
